**Abstract:**
This paper is about Dutch prefixes. 
It uses an example data set from @Pluymaekers2005, cited by @baayen08 [126,338].

# Introduction

```{r blub, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="A very interesting graphical description of the data.", fig.width=5, fig.height=2.5}
ggplot(durationsGe,
       aes(Frequency, DurationOfPrefix))+
  geom_point()+
  scale_x_log10()+
  scale_y_log10()+
  geom_smooth(method=lm)+
  theme_bw()
```


We tried to figure out if the frequency of a word has an influence on the duration of Dutch prefixes. 
Intuitively one could assume that with the duration drops with frequency.
For this we recruited **`r length(unique(durationsGe$Speaker))`** Dutch native speakers.
They produced **`r length(unique(durationsGe$Word))`** different words.
Figure \@ref(fig:blub) gives an overview of the data. We clearly see a downward trajectory.
